meanings.definition: Having a firm, dry texture or quality
meanings.sent1: The apple slices were crispier after baking in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The crackers were much crispier than the bread.
meanings.sent3: I like my potato chips crispier than my friend's.
meanings.sent4: The autumn leaves were crispier than a bag of chips underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The toast was so crispier that it crumbled easily.

meanings.definition: Becoming firm and dry when cooked
meanings.sent1: The cookies were crispier after they cooled down.
meanings.sent2: The bacon was crispier than expected after frying.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out crispier than a biscuit!
meanings.sent4: The firewood crackled, becoming crispier in the flames.
meanings.sent5: The fried chicken was so crispier that it made a satisfying crunch.

meanings.definition: Having a pleasingly firm, dry quality
meanings.sent1: The fresh lettuce was crispier than the wilted one.
meanings.sent2: The cookies were crispier than usual, making them irresistible.
meanings.sent3: The toast was so crispier that it made a delightful sound when bitten.
meanings.sent4: The air in the morning was crispier than a fresh apple.
meanings.sent5: The crackers were so crispier that they seemed to shatter in your mouth.

meanings.definition: Becoming firm and dry when cooked
meanings.sent1: The fish fillet was crispier after being fried.
meanings.sent2: The vegetables were crispier than expected after roasting.
meanings.sent3: The bread turned out crispier than a cracker!
meanings.sent4: The autumn air was crispier than a bag of chips.
meanings.sent5: The fried chicken was so crispier that it was a delight to eat.
